111.title: Boyfriend and girlfriend

1111.content:
"Very good, but I have to warn you, the costumes here make you become whatever you dress up as." Dr. Babbingtree said. A small twinkle flashed in his eye.

"Well isn't that what costumes are supposed to do?" The young man sarcastically replied. "We'll just browse for now." He said as he led his girlfriend down the first row of aisles.

"Very well, be careful not to get lost." Dr. Babbingtree cautioned the couple as they left.

What kind of costumes do they need?

Fictional Creatures (same gender) - werewolves, vampires, swamp beasts, unicorns, fairies, leprecauns,
Couple - Prisoner & Guard, Bugs Bunny & Daffy Duck, Ichigo & Rukia, etc
Reverse-Gender - Man as female supermodel, Medusa, mermaid, etc. Woman as male pro wrestler, the Hulk, Centaur (male), etc.
1111.title: become whatever they dress up as

11112.content:
The two went into the depths of the shop. "Why do you always have to be like that, Jimmy? He was just trying to be friendly and make a sale. You're always acting like you're twelve and not twenty-three." Angela, his twenty-one year old girlfriend asked.

Jimmy grabbed her arm, hard and snarled, "Listen! I'm not gonna take any shit from some old fart who can't do more than sit on his ass and get his jollies watching the young girls playing dress-up. Now, I said we were gonna do a party this Halloween and we are? You got a problem with that?"

He let go and she whimpered, "No, I-I'm good."

"Fine. Let's pick out something and get the hell outta here. This place gives me the creeps." Angela rubbed her arm as soon as Jimmy turned away from her. In truth, she wanted to leave him, but was terrified of his violent temper. She never knew when he would explode, but he often did and when it happened, she always paid for it, one way or another...

They wandered around the store for some time, seeing aisles marked as Classic Monsters, Mythological Monsters, Cartoon Characters and Anime Characters before finding a section labeled Couples. "J-Jimmy?" He turned and she backed up, fearing a slap. This time, he merely looked at her. She asked, "Do you want to try down this aisle?" She pointed, her hand shaking slightly.

Jimmy smiled. He had this one trained pretty well. She wasn't completely broken yet, but she would be soon and he'd leave her then. It was how he got his rush, making a girl so she couldn't function without him, then leaving them broken by the wayside to wither and die while he moved on to his next challenge. For him, it was all about the challenge of taking some uppity bitch and bringing them down to where they belonged, scraping along in the dirt.

He motioned for her to go first and watched her move slowly down the aisle. Maybe he'd take her back here. She'd hate it, having him take her and no where to clean herself afterward. She'd hate him for doing it even while her body enjoyed the rush sex always brought to it. He smiled to himself as she looked at the costumes. Finally, she pulled out two costumes. He chuckled as he looked at her choices. One, his, had to be Popeye. The outfit looked as if it had come right out of the cartoon show. Hers was Popeye's girlfriend, Olive Oyl. It even had a tiny stuffed Jeep hanging on one sleeve.

"These are good," he said, watching as she breathed a sigh of relief. "You know, I've always wanted to watch Popeye doing Olive. Let's change and do it here. The old man will never know," he added as she looked worriedly toward the front of the store.

"But what about the costumes?"

"So what?" he snapped, watching her cower back, "People do strange shit in these things all the time. Now, get your ass changed!" Angela stripped and struggled into her costume. Angela had fairly small breasts, but as she recalled, Olive was totally flat-chested. Finally, she had gotten into the costume. Jimmy was scowling, taking in the too short pants and too big shirt. But, he had to admit, he did like the corncob pipe and the cap. He was looking into a mirror he'd found and noticed the shirt wasn't as big as he'd originally thought. The pants were getting longer, too. He looked over at Angela and saw what little breasts she had had were gone now. She was taller and very skinny. And, the Jeep blinked at him as if it were alive. He closed his eyes and shook his head. This had to be a dream. When he looked again, the doll was just that, a doll sewn onto the arm of a costume.

"Okay baby, pull that dress up and bend over. I'm gonna give it to you right here and now!" His voice had changed, becoming rougher and sounding like he'd been chewing gravel.

"No!" she said shrilly, sounding like the Olive he remembered from the show. "It's not right and you can't keep doing this to me, Jimmy. I won't let you do this any more!" she rebuked him even as her hands went to cover her mouth, her face showing shocked horror at what she'd said.

Before Jimmy could do more than draw back his arm, the Jeep sprang from Olive's arm onto his chest. "W-What?" he yelped in surprise as the Jeep bit him with amazingly sharp teeth. Jimmy began backpedaling as quickly as he could, trying to get away from the tiny creature. Before he knew what had happened, a black circle had formed under him and he fell into it, the Jeep going with him. Jimmy landed hard, grunting as the air was knocked out of his lungs. By the time he could sit up, he recognized where he was... He was on the Isle of the Goonies. He had to get away. He knew Popeye was supposed to marry the Goonie Princess and if he were caught. He looked up and far away, he could see Angela looking down at him. Even as he watched, the circle grew smaller and smaller, finally disappearing. He had to get away! Not far off, he could hear the shuffle of footsteps as the Goonies came, looking for whoever was on their island. "No!" his mind screamed at him. He Had To Get Away!

Hands reached out and took hold of him. He struggled, but was soon overpowered and carried toward the village. He pulled out his can of spinach and gobbled it down. He felt energized and strong again. He broke free and ran toward the shore. Everywhere, Goonies came for him. He ran, fighting through Goonies by the dozens. He ran and still more came for him. And the whole time, all he could think was how he had enjoyed making Angela do things she had hated doing. Now, the roles were reversed and sobbing, he ran for the beach. HE HAD TO GET AWAY!!

Angela walked back up to the front of the shop and handed the old man her costume. "I don't want this, but the matching Popeye costume is..." she hesitated, unsure of what to say.

"Ah yes, that does happen sometimes in this shop," the old man said soothingly. "I'll tell you what. You take this coupon and if you decide you'd like a different costume for Halloween, come on back and I'll take twenty percent off the price, but just for you. So, don't come in with a bunch of friends looking for that discount for everyone." he smiled and she laughed as she walked out, feeling somehow much better than when the day had started. The old man looked into a small black and white television while Jimmy fought off Goonies. What Jimmy didn't know was Goonies always split into two more Goonies when they were killed. If one died, it was dead; but kill one and you got two goonies. "Sit on my ass and watch the girls play dress-up? Really Jimmy, I had so hoped for more from you than that." He smiled down as he watched Jimmy being dragged back to his wedding with the Goonie Princess.

The door to his shop opened with a ring, as Charles Babbingtree noticed a young couple had entered his store. He accurately guessed that they were just married, eyes filled with love for each other and their futures fill of possibilities. The husband was a tall chap, dark haired with muscles that suggested he worked out every other day. His wife was much smaller than him, probably less than five feet tall. She had a cute butt and B cups as well as dirty blond hair that was done in girlish pig-tails. She had her arms around her husband's waist as they approached Babbingtree.

"Greetings! Welcome to my costume shop! What can I do you for?"

"Hello, my name's Jon, this is my wife Sarah. We're here looking for a costume for a dinner party that's next week. We're hoping you can make some helpful suggestions."

"Certainly! What sort of party is it now?"

"Oh, just a couples costume party. We're supposed to go in entire a single costume or a theme." answered Sarah.

"Oh good, we have plenty of those costumes here! Wait right there I'll grab something from the back."

Babbingtree stumbled to the back of his shop. Much mumbling was heard as well as a giant crash followed by swearing. He returned with several costumes in hand, as well as a bruise on his forehead.

"Take your pick my good friends."

Another would be the horse's back and would have to bend over, claiming the horse's rear and hide legs. The suit had two zippers for the front and back, for two people it seemed a very tiny fit. Perhaps not for Sarah but maybe for Jon being over six feet. But the costume did intrigue Jon nonetheless.

"That horse costume..." Jon said,"Looks interesting, don't you think honey?"

"Huh?" she said, staring at a witches' pair costumes, "I guess so...Whatever you want dear. It's your friend's party."

"Then we'll take the horse costume...Mister...uh..."

Babbingtree smiled, "Of course, of course! And since this is for a party I'll let you rent it for free. Just be sure to bring it back when you're finished, understood?"

Babbingtree handed them the costume. He could tell that though this was a budding couple, their relationship would not end well. Sarah obeyed her husband's every whim and decision, while Jon remained oblivious to her needs and wants. A good couple would always listen to each others opinions before making a final choice in anything. "I wonder," He mumbled to himself. "I wonder what part of the horse each of them will choose...That costume acts in such mysterious ways..."

------------------------------------------------------------

A week had passed in the newly bought house of Jon and Sarah. Halloween was tomorrow and while the children would be busy gathering as much candy as humanly possible, the parents would be doing their best to work off their hangovers from the adult costume parties they attended. Jon was sitting on the couch watching TV while Sarah was busy doing her hair in the bathroom.

"Honey," He yelled to her. "We're going to be late! The party starts in an hour and we haven't even tried on the costume yet to make sure it fits!"

Sarah rolled her eyes. "That's because you've been too busy golfing all week," She thought to herself.

"Where is the thing anyway?" Asked Jon as he stretched on the couch.

"Right where you left it last week, buried under the stack of newspapers on the kitchen table!"

"What's her problem...," He muttered and he made his way to the horse costume.

He pulled it from it's tomb of last week's news and held it up to see. Despite having not seen the light of day for a week, it still seemed very clean and soft. He stared into the black horse eyes of the mask, it almost was like he was holding a real horse's head. Sarah came out of the bathroom with a towel wrapped around her head.

"Dibs on the head part." Jon said with a smile.

"Yes dear, whatever you want."

"I don't know why you did your hair if it's just going to get messed up inside of here...You want to go in first? I think the person in the back is supposed to enter the suit before the one in the front does."

The costume had come in one of those clear bags, this one was larger than usual so it would hold all the pieces of the horse. The first thing to put on was the pair of hooves meant for the back legs. They looked almost like a pair of fuzzy brown stockings. Jon handed them to Sarah as she removed her pink bath slippers. She sat down and slowly put the first one on. It seemed to fit snugly on her, considering she put it on in no time flat. She motioned for the other one and put that one on very quickly too. She stood up and had to balance herself on the couch's arm. With the horse legs disappearing up her bathrobe she looked almost like a Satyr from Greek legends.

"Looking good...," Jon said while blushing slightly. "What's it like? Are they comfortable?"

"It's...a little like walking in high heels." She responded as she took several baby steps forward. "These are so fuzzy and comfy though...I might even wear them to bed."

Jon laughed and took up his own pair of horse legs to wear. He kicked his shoes off into the wall, much to his disapproving wife's dismay, and slowly began to put them on. Unlike Sarah, who's legs were small and delicate, Jon had large clown feet and muscular legs. This of course meant he had a much more difficult time putting on the horse stockings, so much so that Sarah had to come over to give him a hand before he hurt himself. Eventually he too was sporting two satyr like legs and was wobbling around the living room.

"These are pretty cool!" He tried wiggling his toes but found them to be wedged between the leg and hoof of the costume. "What part do we put on next?"

"According to the bag...It's the body then the head."

The body was like a large brown bag with three holes in it. One for the head of the horse, and two for the bodies of the wearers. This of course meant Sarah would have to bend over slightly while Jon got to stand upright. Jon entered his hole first, it was very hot and muggy inside the suit but it was also soft and furry like a real horse. He rested the body of the costume on his shoulders while he put his hands to the side to make the costume look convincing. Sarah entered next, she squirmed her way inside the small opening as the hole went up to her horse legs. When Jon looked back she had completely disappeared into the suit. He tapped where she would be only to feel a small slap on his butt.

"Ow...Honey, are you okay in there?"

"Mmmf Mmmf! (Yeah fine!)" She mumbled in reply.

"Can you breathe alright in there? I mean we're going to be like this all night."

"Mmf mmff! Mff Mf Mmmf Mmmme! (Don't worry! I'll be fine honey!)"

115231.content:
"Great! Let's try them on, then!" exclaims Allison, a big smile on her face

"Which costume am I wearing?" asked Kira

"The hero of the story." replied Allison, as she handed the albino teen the green tunic and everything that came with it.

As soon as Kira accepted the costume, Allison began pushing her towards the changing rooms. Once inside, she closed the door and laid out all the different pieces of her costume. Analyzing each individual piece, she realized there were a couple of pieces that she hadn't been able to see when Allison held up the costume. In addition to everything else, there was a thin, brown leather corset, as well as a choker made of soft brown leather. Face red as a firetruck, Kira began to remove her schoolgirl costume. She cursed Allison for not letting her wear panties or a bra with her schoolgirl costume, since this costume didn't come with any. Once that was done, she unbraided her hair, before pinning it up so she could put the wig on. With the wig firmly in place, she proceeded to wrap the corset around her waist. She pushed through the strain of lacing up and tightening the corset as her waist shrunk inch by inch, causing her already large chest to bulge. Satisfied with the tightness, Kira knotted the laces and collected the next piece: the white tights. She sat down on the pile of clothing on the chair made by her old costume, and slipped her legs into the tights. Standing up so as to pull the tights up the rest of the way, she found that they wouldn't go on properly without riding up into her ass and crotch, giving her a visible came toe.

'I hope the tunic hides that at least a little bit.' thought Kira with dread, as she would be wearing this in public, but also a hint of excitement, as Allison would see her in it.

She collected the white shirt and slipped into it. Once it was smoothed out, it fit her like a second skin. She could see the lines of the corset showing through, but expected the tunic to cover it. Next up was the boots. Kira sat down and slowly squirmed her feet into the tight leather containers. Upon standing up, she was amazed at how comfortable and well broken-in these boots were, even though they didn't look old or worn. Next came the tunic. She put the green fabric over her head and pulled her blonde hair through the top. She looked in the mirror, and while it showed significantly more cleavage than she would ever show in public of her own volition, it also hid her camel toed crotch, which she was thankful for. Next she closed the slim brown belt around her waist and set her eyes on the last few items. First she tied back her blonde hair so she could apply the costume glue and add the elven ears without incident. While that dried, she opened up the small makeup kit that had come with the costume. On the inside of the lid, there was an image of the recommended makeup application, which showed pink lips, rosy cheeks, and alluring black mascara and eyeliner. There was also a set of blue coloured contacts inside. Once she had applied the makeup as instructed and put in the contacts, the glue was dry, so she let her hair down. She stared in awe at the near stranger that looked back at her in the mirror as she fastened the buckles on the leather gauntlets. So close to finished, she jumped when she heard a knock on the door.

"You almost done?" came Allison's voice from the other side of the door

"Almost." replied Kira, as she pulled on Link's green hat

"Can I see?" she asked

Kira smiled softly as she opened the door for her girlfriend. The two women stared at each other in awe for a moment. Allison wore the clothing even better than Kira had imagined. The long blue hair fell wildly around her face, giving her a look of primal alien beauty. She had blue painted lips, blue dusted cheeks, blue eye makeup, and her cheeks, cleavage, arms and thighs seemed to be sporadically covered in tiny blue crystals.

"I- I- wow." said Allison

Kira blushed in response.

"What else do you have to put on?" asked Allison

Kira collected the choker and presented it to the beautiful fairy. Allison stroked the soft leather before gently closing her hair around it. Her eyes met Kira's.

"May I?" she asked

Kira responded by wordlessly turning around and lifting her hair away from her neck. Allison stepped up behind her so close that Kira could feel her breasts against her back. As the leather of the choker brushed against her neck, Kira felt safe. She knew that with Allison beside her, she could do anything.

"Is it too tight?" asked Allison, as she fastened the choker shut

It wasn't. Allison's loving hands had managed the perfect blend of firmness and comfort.

"No, it's perfect. Thank you." replied Kira

What next?

She started to panic, and ran out the entrance... Into open air. She found herself doing a Wile Coyote pause in mid-air, but soon realized that she wasn't falling. Allison didn't need to be told twice. She flew to Kokiri Village as fast as her wings would carry her.

115231222.content:
Kira found herself standing in a field at night. There was a castle and drawbridge in front of her with a great expanse of field behind her. Looking at herself, she realized she wasn't 18 anymore. She had de-aged 7 years, and as a result had less outstanding features. From what she could tell, she was shorter by more than a foot. The outfit she was wearing had changed as well. She was now wearing only a tunic, belt, hat and boots. The tunic fit her smaller chest and fell a few inches short of her knees at the hem. Her self analysis was cut short when a white horse nearly trampled her. The horse had two passengers. A silver haired woman and a young blonde girl.

Kira realized where she was. She turned around and came face to face with Ganondorf, riding his black steed. The villainous wizard raised a hand and energy gathered in it. Just as he threw it at her, she heard a voice call for her.

'KIRA!'

And then she woke up.

'Huh, wouldn't have pegged Saria for a perv. This will come in useful later.' thought Allison with a smile

"Hey Link, it's so good to see you?" asked Saria

"I bet it is." replied Allison, snickering

Saria looked up and saw Allison.

"Wow, Link, you got a fairy! That's wonderful. I knew this day would come." said Saria

"This is A-, I mean, this is Navi." said Kira

"It's lovely to meet you, Navi. Congratulations, Link. I have some chores to do, but I'll see you around." said Saria before running off

"Seems like someone has an admirer." commented Allison as they walked up the hill towards the hiding place of the Kokiri sword.

"Saria, really?" asked Kira

"Yupp. She just stood there looking up your tunic while you climbed down the ladder."

Kira's cheeks flushed.

"This gives me an idea though." said Allison

Kira looked at the fairy girl curiously.

"What kind of idea?"

They reached the small tunnel, and Kira got on her knees to crawl inside. But not before Allison flew down her shirt and settled in between her breasts.

"Enjoying activities with my girlfriend befitting the body of a three inch tall sprite." replied Allison

"Okay, fine."

Kira evaded the slow rolling boulder and easily collected the Kokiri sword. She strapped the blade to her back and made her way back to Kokiri Village. It only took 15 minutes to gather enough rupees to purchase the Deku Shield on sale at the shop. Then it was time to face Mido.

"Even if I wanted to let you pass, you'd die without a sword and shield... which you have. I still don't want to let you through." said Mido

"Complaint noted, now move." ordered Allison

Mido grumbled his little narcissistic mutterings to himself as he walked out of the way. With smiles on their faces, Kira and Allison continued. With singular strokes of
her sword, Kira cut down the deku babas on the path to the Deku Tree. The Deku Tree told them about how he was dying, and they needed to kill the parasites inhabiting him. Honestly they just tuned him out for the most part, until he opened his mouth and they were able to get to work. Kira crossed the room and climbed the vines to reach the second floor. Unlike the game Navi, Allison stayed quiet to let Kira focus. Kira collected the dungeon map and took out the deku scrub with ease.

"If you fall from a high ledge, you can roll to avoid fall damage. But it won't work if the ledge is really high." advised the scrub, before disappearing

Kira entered the next room, which contained a floating platform and a chest on a far ledge.

"Hey, drop down and climb up the vines." advised Allison

"Why?"

She collected the Slingshot from the chest and used the platform to cross the gap as it crumbled beneath her feet. Once she had killed the skulltulas on the vine wall, she was able to reach the third floor. Deciding not to bother getting the compass, she killed one of the skulltulas guarding the ledge and jumped off. She broke through the webbing that covered the whole in the 1st floor and fell into the water in the basement. Several predictably challenging rooms later, and she found herself standing at the door to the Boss chambers. Inside, the giant arachnid Queen Gohma dropped from the ceiling. Kira quickly caught her in the eye with a deku nut, stunning her, and proceeded to slash her in the eye. Gohma regained her senses after a few slashes and attempted to retreat to the ceiling. But a slingshot round to the eye dropped her back down to the floor, where Kira finished her off. A heart container appeared, and when she picked it up, Kira felt a surge of energy fill her. She stepped into the column of light that appeared, and they were transported back outside.

The Deku Tree told them all the things they already knew about the upcoming darkness. So they took the Kokiri Emerald and set out for Hyrule castle. They ignored Mido and kept walking. They reached the bridge, and found Saria waiting for them.

"I guess I always knew this day would come. Please, take this Ocarina. And remember, I would do absolutely anything for you. Anything." said Saria, before running back into the forest

"Why do I get the feeling that she really meant ANYTHING?" asked Kira

Allison just laughed.

As they reached the entrance to Hyrule Field, they encountered the most annoying owl in existence.

"Ow!"

Kira shot him again.

"Stop that!"

And again.

"Fine, I'm leaving."

And he did.

"Is it weird that I was a little turned on by that?" asked Allison

Kira rolled her eyes and started walking. They moved quickly enough that they got past the drawbridge before sunset. They didn't bother with the marketplace; they just headed straight for Hyrule Castle. Kira already knew they wouldn't be able to get through the front gate, so instead they approached the vine wall. There was a ginger farm girl standing next to the vine wall singing.

"Excuse me, are you going into Hyrule Castle?" she asked

"That's wonderful news. My name is Malon. My dad runs the Lon Lon Ranch near the castle. He went into the castle to deliver a shipment of milk, but he hasn't returned." she explained

"We'll find him for you." said Kira

Allison just kept on laughing at Kira's predicament.

122311211.content:
"A cow? Be careful boy, women can be easily offended by that sort of thing." the shopkeeper warned Steve.
"It's ok, she can take a joke." he reassured and they continued along the aisle. Soon they came to a junction that was dominated by a large sign. In one direction were costumes of magical things of all kinds and in the other were various animal costumes. Babbingtree lead his customer swiftly down the animal section before stopping and peering at a small index to his right. After a moment he slammed his fist against the side of the shelves and a small platform emerged from the bottom. He stepped on the platform and pressed a small button on the index and the panel was propelled upwards at great speed before stopping abruptly six metres up. He then returned with an extremely detailed cow suit.
"This'll fit any adult." he stated "it costs ten dollars per day to rent and thirty dollars to buy."
"I'll just rent it thanks." Steve said quickly.

"Please sign your name here." he requested and wished Steve a good day after he did so.
         It was a short journey home for Steve. When he got in, he immediately took it up to his room to hide it. He stopped to read the label inside.
One size fits all cow suit
do not wash
return within six days

12232.content:
"Uh, yeah, I'm looking for a Halloween costume," the rather nervous looking teen replied, rubbing uncomfortably at the back of his neck.

It was painfully clear to Babbingtree that this boy wasn't the most confident person in the world, looking rather awkward and uncomfortable as he stood there gazing aimlessly around the store. "Well you're definitely in the right place for that, young man," Babbingtree told him with a smile, finding his demeanor amusing, well aware that he had numerous items and outfits in the store that could soon change that. "What sort of thing was it you were after?"

"Uhm, well, the thing is, it's not really for me...it's for my girlfriend."

"Oh I see, your girlfriend," Babbingtree chuckled, thinking for a moment that another one of those 'curious cross-dresser' sorts had entered his store.

"Yeah, she...uh, she thought it'd be a good idea if we chose each others costumes for Halloween," the teen continued, ignoring the owner's giggles, "You know, sort of for fun. But I'm...I'm not exactly sure what to get her."

Sensing that the boy was sincere (shy and geeky; yes, but sincere all the same) and that this outfit was not for him, Babbingtree was rather relieved, happy to have a genuine customer with a genuine problem to assist (rather than endlessly watching a parade of sexually confused, yet curious young men perusing the female only costumes with no intention to actually buy), this being the kind of thing that he lived for. "Well don't you worry about that, son, Dr. Babbingtree is here to help. First thing's first though, you'll have to tell me a little about this girlfriend of yours."

As shy as he was, the boy found himself strangely enough opening up to the wizened old man behind the counter, answering as soon as the question was asked. "Uh, okay. Her name is Vicky and well, she's kind of like me," he said, "Into comics and movies and computer games and stuff....except, y'know, she's a girl." This much seemed obvious enough to Babbingtree, the likelihood of her being a cheerleader or prom queen or anything being pretty slim to nil, seeing as this young man didn't exactly seem all that high up on the social ladder.

"Well that doesn't give me a lot to go on..." the store owner replied, scratching at his long gray beard, waiting for the young man's name.

"Uh, Reece, Reece Taylor," the teen quickly answered, the words continuing to just spew out of his mouth, as if outwith his control. "We haven't actually been going out very long, only for like three months. And she's my first girlfriend so..."

"So you don't want to choose badly and mess things up, right?"

"Yeah, something like that."

"Well, as I said, don't worry, I'll help you find the perfect costume," the old man once again smiled, stepping out from behind the counter and placing a reassuring hand on Reece's shoulder, "And all for a low, low price. Now come, follow me."

Doing as he was told, Babbingtree then led Reece towards the back of the store where the majority of the costumes were located; all sectioned off into various categories in the many different racks, and all of them covered by a thin plastic sleeve (presumably to keep them from getting dirty or damaged). "Wow..." Reece muttered under his breath, having never seen so many costumes before, and especially not inside a store that had looked so tiny on the outside.

Watching as Babbingtree searched through the many racks, pulling out the occasional giant bunny or witches costume, before shaking his head disparagingly and putting them back, he eventually turned to his young customer and said, "Now, I'll level with you here Reece, I could just give fob you off with some fuzzy cat costume or something and tell you that your girlfriend would love it and think that you're the most awesome boyfriend ever or whatnot...but you and I know that just wouldn't be truth. You see, this to me appears like some sort of test; a test by your girlfriend to find out exactly what kind of boyfriend you really are."

This however seemed a little far fetched to Reece, and he responded somewhat skeptically, "Really?...You think?"

"Of course! Why else would she get you to choose her Halloween costume?" Babbingtree asked, grabbing Reece once again by the shoulder and giving him a playful little shake, "Take it from me, son, there always doing this kind of thing; women. You won't believe the amount of young guys that come in here in this exact same situation as you are right now, with no idea what costume to get or why. And you know what I tell them?"

"No, what?"

"I tell them that the best thing to do is to stop trying to guess what this 'Vicky' of yours wants and start thinking instead about what you want. What kind of costume would Reece like to see his little lady all dressed up in for Halloween? That there is the best place to start." Although he had been somewhat skeptical at first, thinking that perhaps this old man was just having some fun (which he clearly was, the store being very much a magical and mischievous place that changed the lives of all who entered, though usually in a good way), Reece was gradually being taken in by his words, believing more and more of what was being said, much to Babbingtree's delight. One night of dressing up in a silly costume and going to some ridiculous party every year may seem like fun to most, but not to him, not when he could use his knowledge and his powers to benefit his customers even more, in a way perhaps that even they didn't quite expect. "Take this sexy nurse outfit for example," he continued, suddenly pulling out another costume from somewhere nearby and holding it up, "Do you think you'd like to see Vicky dressed up in something like this? Something that'll please you a lot more than it'll please her...if you know what I mean?"

Reece of course knew exactly what he meant, but that didn't stop him from feeling a little shocked at the suggestion as he pictured his cute and geeky (and in others mind's no doubt, slightly plain) girlfriend dressed up in an outfit like that. "I, uh....I don't know about that..." he nervously muttered, not entirely sure what kind of reaction that would provoke. Not that this mattered to Babbingtree of course, knowing all to well that as shy and as unassuming as he appeared, and as worried as he was about not upsetting or angering his girlfriend, Reece was still just like any other teenage boy and sex was definitely almost always on his mind.

"Reece, my boy, Halloween, playing make believe and dressing up is all about fantasy..." Babbingtree assured him, putting the nurse's costume back and directing him towards a variety of similarly themed outfits, "...and about desires. If you want to get anywhere with that little girlfriend of yours then you've got to stop all this worrying and learn to explore these desires." Then, as if suddenly reaching into his very head and picking out his thoughts, the old man continued, "Now you may not have been going out for very long and things may not be proceeding quite as quickly in the physical department as you may like, but believe you me, you pick her out a sexy little costume for Halloween like she's clearly wanting you to, and I assure you, you'll have yourself a night you won't long forget."

This was music to Reece's ears, Babbingtree basically saying exactly what he wanted to hear, having long wished he and Vicky could progress past the kissing and cuddling stage of their relationship, but being to shy and nervous to take things any further himself.. "You...you really think so?" he said, being almost wholeheartedly ready to believe that a mere Halloween costume could do all this for him, as if there was also some sort of magic here at work...which of course there was.

Flashing the young man a big, satisfied grin, happy that his plan was working, Babbingtree then replied, "I know so," before indicating to the various costumes before them and asking, "Now tell me, Reece, what's your fantasy?"
12232.title: A Halloween costume for his girlfriend

choices: Reece returns home with the cheerleader costume
Skip to Halloween night, a few days later
122321.content:
"Muh-my fantasy?" Reece stuttered, not entirely sure how to answer this question, gazing up in disbelief at a selection of very sexy and very adult orientated, female Halloween costumes hanging from the wall, having only ever seen such outfits in comics or in movies (or occasionally at night during one of his porno surfing sessions) before.

"Yes, your fantasy," Babbingtree once again repeated, spelling it out for the poor boy, "What kind of thing gets your motor running, etc."

"I uh...I dunno."

"Reece, please. Don't give me that. I know you might like to come across as the shy and retiring type who has the utmost respect for girls, Vicky especially, but believe you me when I say, I really have heard it all before. I may be an old codger but I know what young guys like yourself are into; all big boobs and skimpy outfits, loose morals and a total lack of inhibitions when it comes to sex, and I know that deep down you're just the same." Though he didn't like to admit it, for fear of being labeled a pervert or something, Babbingtree was right, these were exactly the kind of things Reece did fantasize about a lot; what with being a 17 year old virgin with a very active imagination and a lot of time spent alone in front of his computer. "Now c'mon, there's no need to be embarrassed, tell old Babbingtree who your fantasy women is," he continued, flashing Reece a warm and trusting smile, "who you'd really like Vicky to be given half the chance."

Having won him over again, the old man's words being almost hypnotic in their delivery, Reece found himself once again revealing things he'd never revealed to any other living being, grinning and blushing a little as he did. "Well I guess I do have this one kind of dream girl in my head. Her name is Shawna, she's a cheerleader who goes to the same school as me and Vicky, and she's like super hot with huge big boobies and the most incredible ass ever," he said, becoming rather animated in his description as he pictured the girl in question, "The way it jiggles around under that tight little skirt of hers is...is unbelievable!" Giggling a little at his own enthusiasm, and becoming slightly embarrassed again, he then added a little more calmly, "That is, I mean...I guess sometimes I kinda wish that Vicky could look like that..."

"I don't blame you, this girl sounds like a real firecracker!" Babbingtree happily replied, giving Reece a hard slap on the back, before moving towards one of the many costume racks in front of them, "And luckily for you I think I have just the costume in here somewhere. Sounds to me like you want the 'Busty Cheerleader'."

"'Busty Cheerleader'?...they actually make that costume?"

"They make pretty much every costume, my boy. And when I say 'they', I actually mean 'me'," the old man giggled as he continued rifling through various plastic covered outfits, before pulling one out and showing it to his young customer. "Now here we go, one 'Busty Cheerleader'....Is this the kind of thing you were meaning?"

Looking at the outfit in Babbingtree's hand; a very tight, very revealing looking green and yellow v neck, crop top with the word 'Cheer' printed across the front in bold white lettering, complete with matching pleated skirt, white knee length socks, white sneakers and a pair of yellow pom poms, it was everything Reece had imagined and more, being perhaps a different color to his schools, but far, far skimpier and more revealing. "Wow, yeah!" Reece grinned, a little blown away by the outfit, though at the same time realizing that as hot as it looked it still wouldn't quite be the same as in his fantasies, his girlfriend having rather a skinny, flat chested physique, much different from Shawna's, "I'm just not sure how Vicky will look in it though, she's not exactly the curvy type."

"Don't worry about that, it's got it's own built in curves," Babbingtree informed him, though this not really making a whole lot of sense to Reece (it looking pretty much like any ordinary cheerleading outfit with no sign of padding at all), "Once she puts this little baby on, she'll look like an entirely different person...and feel like one too."

"What do you mean?" the teenager inquired, this added little tidbit of information leaving him doubly confused.

"Well 'Busty Cheerleader' is also 'Horny Cheerleader'..." the store owner teased, shooting Reece a little wink as he began to chuckle, "or haven't you seen any of those stupid teen flicks?"

Realizing that he was just joking, Reece half-sort -of-laughed, "Ha! Oh yeah...right," though at the same time still partly wondering if that was really all that the old man had meant, there certainly being more going on inside this strange store with all these amazing costumes than met the eye.

Breaking him from this thought, Babbingtree then asked, "So do you want it or not?", heading back towards the counter as he did with the costume still in tow, as if he'd already made the decision for him. Even with the rather persuasive owner pushing him, deep down Reece really did want to buy it himself, still having the odd underlying sense of doubt over whether Vicky would like it or not, but that being mainly pushed to the side now by the rather arousing thought of actually seeing her in it. Vicky was a cute girl certainly, but she was no Shawna; her taste in clothes being mostly thick sweaters and hoodies that covered her thin frame, as well as baggy jeans and long skirts that completely obscured her legs. Seeing her dressed in something like this would certainly be an eye opener, especially if it did indeed have padding inside as Babbingtree had alluded to (even pretend big boobs on his girlfriend being a heck of a lot better than practically no boobs at all).

"Yeah, I guess I'll take it," Reece said, following the old man to the counter, "I just hope she likes as much as I do."

"Trust me, Reece, she will," Babbingtree smiled, sounding rather certain about that as he placed the costume onto the counter and pressed a few buttons on his rather old fashioned looking till. "Now here you go, that'll be $9.99, a special discount price just for you."

"Wow, thanks," Reece smiled, not believing his luck as he reached for his wallet, having expected it to be much more expensive that that. That was when it suddenly occurred to him, noticing the rather petite size of the outfit, "Uh, wait. Is this the right size? Will it fit Vicky?" (his girlfriend being thin sure, but clothes were still clothes, and not every size fits everybody).

"One size fits all," came Babbingtree's almost instantaneous reply, as if predicting the question.

This answer unfortunately didn't quite add up to Reece, there clearly being a pair of white sneakers with the costume, and even if the rest of it was super stretchy, they certainly couldn't be, and scratching at his head, he asked, "Oh, how...how does that work?"

"Magic!," Babbingtree smiled, his eyes almost lighting up as he said it. The next thing Reece knew, the old man then plucked a ten dollar note from his wallet and quickly carried out the rest of the transaction himself, bagging up the cheerleader outfit and placing his receipt and his penny change into the bag with it, before sending him on his way, instructing him to have fun, as well as a "Halloween he wouldn't soon forget". And that was that, Reece once again found himself standing outside in the street, this time with a bag in hand and a strange feeling like he'd just been manipulated like some sort of puppet on a string, Babbingtree being one hell of a good salesman, as well as, clearly, a whole lot more than he seemed.

Shrugging this feeling off however, being fairly happy with his purchase as well as rather excited to see Vicky actually wearing it come Halloween night, Reece, gave the strange old costume store one last glance, before heading on his way, the next stop on his journey being home.
122321.title: Busty cheerleader costume

choices: Distracted by the phone call, Reece leaves the costume on the couch
Still chatting with Vicky, Reece grab the costume and heads upstairs
1223211.content:
Several bus journey's later and a rather uncomfortable confrontation with a crazy old drunk man looking for his shoes (Reece living in the quieter, leafier suburbs of town, a good half hour away from the center where the costume store had been located), he finally trundled into the living room of his house and shouted, "Mom, I'm home!"

Reece currently lived alone in a modest two bedroom house with his 42 year old mother, Samantha, who worked as a receptionist in the city, his father having been kicked out several years ago after she'd caught him having an affair with one of his female co-workers. It was of course kind of hard at first for the two of them after he'd left, but gradually, over the years, they had got used to living without him and to each others company; his mom often remarking that they were a lot better off, as well as much closer now without him here than they had been with him. Thankfully, even though it was just him and his mother, she was relatively easy to get along with, being a pleasant and caring woman who loved her son dearly and did her best to provide for him, often acting at times more like a counselor than his mom; helping him with his shyness and trying to get him out into the world as much as humanly possible. It was after all, down to her that he had finally worked up the courage to ask out Vicky, having sat right next to her in chemistry and had feelings for her for well over a year without doing anything about it; being so concerned with rejection and her laughing at him that he'd all but given up on the notion of any sort of relationship. Samantha however, having met Vicky on the odd occasion she'd come over to study (the two of them having frequently been partnered together in class) and seeing what a nice, pleasant girl she was, and how good it would be for Reece to finally have a girlfriend, managed to convince him to just go for it and ask her out, being delighted when she had said yes.

Not that having his mom's approval of his relationship was all peaches and roses, what with her still being his mom and it being embarrassing as hell every time she'd continually question them both about what they were doing, when why and with who, as well as insisting that when Vicky was over that Reece keep his bedroom door open, being somewhat old fashioned when it came to the thought of anything 'inappropriate', as she called it, going on under her roof, believing that when it came to sex, it was best left to responsible adults well over the age of 18. This of course was another reason why Reece had been so afraid to make any kind of move on Vicky, being A. afraid his mom might catch them in the act, and B. worried that she might go crazy if she did, being nice and pleasant and all most of the time, but no less strict and quick to anger when the situation called for it.

Hopefully that would all change come Halloween, he thought to himself, looking down at the bag in his hand and smiling, having the strangest feeling that there was indeed something magical about the costume and that his dreams may soon come true, just as the old store owner had said, especially seeing as his mom would be out of the way for once at her own works party, leaving ample opportunity for him to be alone with Vicky in that sexy little cheerleader outfit. Placing the bag down on the couch, he then headed into the kitchen for a drink, hearing no reply from his mom and remembering that she was still at work and probably wouldn't be back till later this afternoon, having managed to find a costume and return home much earlier than he'd assumed.

Grabbing a soda from the fridge, he heard his cellphone begin to ring, and scrambling around in his pocket for a moment, he pulled it out and saw on the display that it was Vicky calling. "Hey, what's up?" he asked on answering, smiling away happily to himself.

"Hey yourself!" Vicky replied, giggling cutely as she often did, "I'm just at the mall looking for your Halloween costume. What are you up to?"

"That's funny, I just got home after buying yours," Reece replied, finding the coincidence rather amusing.

This came as something of a surprise to Vicky, clearly having expected her rather indecisive boyfriend to hum and haw over what to buy her for days, and certainly having not expected him to beat her to it. "Oh wow, really? You got it already? That was fast."

"Yeah, well I uh, I found this cool place near the mall," he told her, stuttering a little as he said it, not really wanting to give too much away about the place, "It had loads of costumes and stuff inside..."

Unfortunately Vicky's next question was of course,"Where abouts? I haven't found anything that I like for you yet. The ones in the mall all seem to be the same old boring generic thing that everyone else is gonna be wearing."

Kicking himself inside for telling her that, worrying that if she went into the exact same store then she might figure out what he'd bought her and why (not wanting to risk her disapproval), Reece then made a conscious decision not to reveal anything else, and instead try to divert the conversation elsewhere. Unfortunately this was easier said than done, and once again, just as had happened earlier in the store, he found the words once again escaping from his mouth of their own accord, informing Vicky that the store was, "Pretty much across from the main mall entrance, down a narrow alleyway and to the right. It's kind of an old looking place called 'The Costume Store', but the guy behind the counter is really friendly, and helpful."

"Cool. I'll have to check it out," Vicky chirped, almost before he'd even realized what he'd just said, moving quickly onto the more important matters, as she then asked, "So, uh...what did you get me anyway? Will I totally geek out when I see it?"

Hearing the excitement and enthusiasm in her voice and having absentmindedly revealed the location of the store, Reece was almost tempted now to just come out and tell her, figuring that he'd practically given them game away already. Fortunately his better judgment quickly took hold and figuring that even is she did find the store, Babbingtree didn't seem the type to reveal his purchase, and he instead replied, "I'm not telling you that. It's supposed to be a surprise, remember?", calling his girlfriend out for her rather unsubtle little ploy, "It was your idea; Neither one of us gets to know until October 31st when we have to put them on."

"I know, I know. You can't blame a girl for trying though. This Halloween's gonna be so awesome!"

"Yeah, it sure is," Reece agreed, grabbing his soda and heading back into the living room.

choices: Samantha is transformed into a busty, horny cheerleader
Reece in his room suddenly hears strange noises from across the hall
12232111.content:
Distracted by Vicky as the conversation then turned away from Halloween and onto other things, Reece completely forgot about the bag with the 'Busty Cheerleader' costume that was still sitting on the couch where he'd left it minutes before, and instead continued straight on up the stairs towards his bedroom. It was at this point that his mother, Samantha Taylor suddenly walked through the door, having received half the day off due to her boss, Mr. Johnston, feeling particularly generous after having just closed a major deal and making the company an awful lot of money.

"Phew, what a day!" Samantha said as she sat her handbag down on the coffee table and slumped on to of the couch, having been pretty much on her feet all morning, running around like a headless chicken before Mr. Johnston's big deal had finally come through. Kicking off her heels and stretching her legs out, she then noticed the plastic bag seated next to her and looked over to see exactly what it was.

"Is that..is that a Halloween costume?" she thought to herself as she peeked into the bag, spotting something green and yellow wrapped in plastic and pulling out what looked to be a receipt for a place called "The Costume Store'. At first she had assumed that it perhaps belonged to her son, aware that he had actually gone into town today to pick himself up something for Halloween, but on further inspection, recognizing the crop top and pom poms of a cheerleader uniform (having a long time ago been a cheerleader herself), she realized this couldn't be the case; her son (as far as she was aware) not being the type to dress up in a costume meant for a girl. Add to that the fact that she'd only just spoken to Reece about an hour ago when he was just heading in, and knowing how long it took him to make any kind of decision (especially if it meant impressing his girlfriend Vicky), there was no way he'd be back home by now, and he certainly wasn't currently anywhere to be seen. No, this wasn't Reece's, she thought to herself, realizing there had to be only one other explanation; this costume was for her.

"Oh my God, what on earth has she bought me?" Samantha tutted, shaking her head as she pulled the outfit from the bag and held it up, assuming that this was for the Halloween party that was being thrown by her boss at work. While usually parties and large social gatherings weren't really her thing (feeling a little awkward and out of place at them ever since her good-for-nothing husband had left), one of her closest friends and work colleagues, Angela, had finally talked her into attending, promising that she'd have a blast and even going so far as offering to buy them both matching costumes to wear so that she wouldn't feel quite so alone amongst all the various couples. Seeing as she wasn't at work today, having had to attend a meeting out of town, she'd obviously stopped by the house before hand to drop off the costume she'd bought, presumably leaving it with Reece who had forgotten to mention it before he'd gone out and had instead just dumped it on the couch. At least that was the only reasonable explanation she could come up with, little realizing that it was in fact her son who had bought it, and that he was currently upstairs right now, chatting away to the very person he'd bought it for.

Looking at the full thing; the tiny little halter top, skirt, socks, sneakers and pom poms encased within the plastic cover, the outfit looking like it was made more for some skinny little porn starlet than a 42 year old divorcee and mother of a teenage son, Samantha was absolutely mortified, not quite believing what her friend had picked out for her to wear and gasping to herself in shock, "She's got to be joking. Does she seriously expect me to wear this?" It was clear however, that either Angela was having some sort of joke or there been a mix up at the store, Samantha leaning more heavily towards the former, knowing how her friend could be, having been pushing her for quite some time to let her hair down and have what she called "a little fun", frequently teasing her about one of her male colleagues at the office, George, who she was convinced had a crush on her. "C'mon girl, just loosen up a little and maybe wear something that shows a little more skin," she would often laugh, desperate to fix the two of them up, "then trust me, he'll be like a big ball of putty in your hands." Well If this was another dig at her choice of clothes, then Samantha certainly wasn't amused, not really seeing anything wrong with the way she dressed; smart, yet conservative, seeing no reason at all to flaunt her aging body and attract anymore attention than was warranted.

Dropping the costume back into the bag and picking herself up off the couch, continuing to mumble away to herself as she did. "I really can't believe that woman sometimes. She always has to take things way to far. I'm a mother for God sake, not some cheap floozy running around begging for sex!" For a moment Samantha half considered phoning her friend up right now to give her a piece of her mind, but thought better of it, realizing that she'd either still be at her meeting or that it'd only add more fuel to the fire, not being in the mood right now to put up with more of Angela's racy innuendos. She was a good friend certainly, but in this respect the two of them couldn't really be anymore different. So deciding just to leave it for now and buy herself a more suitable costume for the party sometime tomorrow, Samantha grabbed her shoes off the floor and decided to go get changed out of her work clothes. Rather than just head straight up however, Samantha found herself picking the cheerleader outfit up off the couch, rationalizing this action by saying, "I'd better take this too. I don't want Reece getting the wrong idea," before making her way up the stairs, sans heels, and across the hall into her room, where completely unbeknownst to her Reece was still busy chatting away to Vicky, little realizing himself (due in no small part to her silent footsteps) that his mother was now home.

Heading into her bedroom and throwing the bag onto the bed, Samantha went about her usual changing ritual, peeling off her jacket and blouse, then slipping out of her knee length skirt, before rolling her pantyhose down her legs. This time however, instead of heading directly over to her cupboard where the rest of her clothes lay, she found herself for some odd reason glancing back at the plastic bag behind her on the bed, finding that its contents now had some strange sort of pull over her as a rather ridiculous idea began forming in her head. "Okay, now I'm going crazy," she laughed to herself, shaking the though of actually trying on the costume right out of her head, not entirely sure where such an idea had suddenly come from. As much as she tried to fight it though, the thought stayed firmly there, almost as if the costume was willing itself to be worn, if such a thing were possible (which in this case, it was), as she said, "I've been hanging out with Angela way too long!"

Stepping away from the bed, feeling rather embarrassed for even thinking about trying on something that just minutes she'd been horrified had even found its way into her house, Samantha instead turned to face the full length mirror she kept propped up in the corner of the room, and told herself, quite firmly and matter-of-factly that, "I'm 42 years old. I'm well past my prime. I have a 17 year old son who I won't even let in the same room as his girlfriend without keeping the door open, and here I am thinking about putting on a ridiculous fancy dress costume that even she'd struggle to fit into. What is wrong with me?" As she said this however, and examined her underwear clad body in the mirror, she realized that perhaps all of what she'd said wasn't entirely true; being 42 years old with a teenage son certainly, but perhaps not exactly past her prime. While Samantha had never been the supermodel type or anything, she had been told she was quite pretty in her youth, and although with age she had gained a few pounds and a few wrinkles here and there, and although she had long ago convinced herself she was no longer desirable to men after her husband had cheated on her, the evidence before her now suggested something quite to the contrary. If she really wanted to she supposed, and if she did as Angela suggested, perhaps she could get George interested in her...he was rather attractive after all, and she hadn't been with a man in quite a few years...

"Oh what the hell!" she proclaimed, looking back round at the costume and deciding to throw caution to the wind and try it on after all, if only out of curiosity and for a bit of fun, telling herself that, "Reece hopefully won't be back for a while and it'll be interesting to see if I can still carry off the outfit from back in my cheerleading days."

With her mind made up, giggling to herself like some over excited teenager, realizing what she was doing was utterly ridiculous but deciding to go through with it anyway, Samantha then fished the outfit from the bag and lined the various pieces out on the bed, little suspecting that there was magic at work, magic that had been meant for Reece's girlfriend...

12322.content:
"Young man, I'd wager you're looking for a fantasy costume, are you not? Something from a world not our own—a world of magic, swordplay and high adventure!"

"Why…yes," said Eliot. "How did you know?"

"Your hands, my boy, your hands. I find that you can often learn a great deal about someone from careful examination of his hands. There is no better indication of what a man wants than how he chooses to spend his time, and everything a man does is recorded in his hands. It has become popular of late to describe the eyes as 'the windows to the soul,' but a good liar can twist his face to say whatever he wishes. No, if you truly wish to know a man, look to his hands."

"Uh, thanks, I guess," said Eliot.

"Ah, I ramble!" said Babbingtree. "You seek a costume, not a lecture! I apologize; I sometimes get carried away when discussing my craft. Come, what you seek is this way."

Examining the fantasy 'section'—though 'wing' might be a more appropriate term, given the size of the store—Eliot found no shortage of suitable outfits. All the costumes were of exceptionally high quality—all the fabrics were thick, rich and authentic with none of the unnatural sheen that too often spoiled otherwise fine sets. No, every piece of clothing here looked like it came straight from the set of a high-budget movie. The selection of pseudo-medieval armor was particularly striking—full sets of shining steel armor that looked every bit as authentic as genuine museum pieces. Not only the armors were impressive—the attention to detail was such that any one of these costumes would surely be the talk of G-con. After nearly an hour spent admiring the incredible workmanship in all the costumes, Eliot found one that he simply had to have. It was…
12322.title: A fantasy costume

choices: Turn around and continue searching for the checkout.
123221.content:
Eliot knew he didn't have the muscles to pull off wearing one of the warrior get-ups successfully—he'd seen all too many pale, gangly nerds make fools of themselves trying to dress like muscle-bound action heroes. No, an important part of a successful costume was body shape, and Eliot simply wasn't a warrior. Fortunately, there's not a great deal of physical difference between a powerful sorcerer who spends his days studying ancient mystical tomes and a socially awkward college student who spends his days reading cheesy soft-cover fantasy novels. With this reassurance and a half a semester of acting classes under his belt, Eliot selected the flowing white robes confident that he could easily pull off the role. Technically, the robes came from the section labeled "Clerics, Druids and members of priestly orders," but he figured it hardly mattered. A fantasy-style robe was a fantasy-style robe, right?

After slipping the robes over his shoulders and admiring the fit, Eliot was suddenly struck by just how big this store really was. He hadn't really noticed as he'd been guided through the winding shelves by the talkative owner, but now faced with navigating the twisting racks himself Eliot realized he had no idea how to get back to the front of the store. However, upon consideration Eliot found he could make out the faint sound of voices several racks over. At first Eliot was surprised, but then berated himself for his silliness. Of course there were other people in the store—there was no way an operation this large survived by serving one customer at a time, after all! Making his way toward the source of the noise, Eliot considered the least embarrassing way to ask for directions. Should he simply say he'd gotten 'turned around' or should he open with some kind of casual remark on the confusing layout of the store?

As Eliot rounded the final corner, though, the question became entirely academic. At the other end of the isle was not a couple looking for costumes, but landscape. Instead of more rows of costumes, the hallway emptied onto a wide vista of rolling hills and a tiny village visible in the distance. Now, Babbingtree's was a big store, but even this place couldn't contain several square miles of open countryside. Whatever this was, it was something far outside the ordinary.
123221.title: A rich, flowing white and gold robe perfect for...

choices: Forget the adventurers and head for the village.
1232211.content:
In general, Eliot was what others might describe as 'a cautious fellow.' He didn't like the unexpected, and would, if pressed, rather forgo jam on his morning toast than risk ruining it with spread from an unfamiliar label. He didn't drink milk that was fewer than three days away from the expiry date, he didn't sit for an exam with fewer than six auxiliary #2 pencils, and he always came to a full and complete stop at marked intersections. So when Eliot gathered his courage and took a flying leap into an unfamiliar and impossible world, it would have been perfectly reasonable to take a moment to congratulate himself on a moment of profound personal growth. Of course, Eliot refrained from such frivolity—mostly because he'd fainted before he hit the ground.

From behind, hidden effortlessly within the store that was his masterwork, Babbingtree chuckled softly.

"Good show, my boy!" he smiled. "I knew you weren't as timid as you appeared! You have a brave heart, lad, I saw it; you were merely wanting for the right kind of adventure. Well, you'll have it now, and unless I miss my guess both you and those you meet will be better for it."

Babbingtree chuckled softly at Eliot's unconscious form sprawled across the grass just beyond the gateway.

"If only you knew how many of the truly great began as meekly. Though I do imagine that when you awake you'll be wishing you'd paid a little more heed to my careful labeling. I make up those cards for a reason, you know."

With a final wistful sigh, Babbingtree waved his hands and sealed the gateway between worlds with as much ceremony as a tired commuter closing the front door of his apartment after a long day.

**********

The first thing Eliot learned from his adventure was that, no matter what cartoons and romance movies say, fainting is not at all like falling asleep. When he awoke, it was not with a flutter of eyelashes and a soft-spoken query as to what had befallen him. Instead, Eliot shot upright with a violent, heaving gasp more commonly associated with the nearly drowned than the recently awakened. Eyes wide and heart racing, Eliot glanced fearfully about with enough adrenaline coursing through his veins to wake the dead. Indeed, by the time pure, animalistic survival instinct had given enough ground to reason for the formation of coherent thoughts, this was one of his first considerations—was he dead? He had, after all, leapt through a doorway of light into an idyllic, peaceful meadow; the idea that this might be some kind of classical afterlife was not entirely absurd. However, the presence of a few decidedly un-heavenly sensations quickly dissolved such notions. For one thing, his head throbbed with pain from his fall; for another, the entire valley smelled of manure. Either heaven was depressingly mundane or he had in fact landed in an actual meadow.

However, further musings on the status of his immortal soul were cut short by a less ultimately significant but more immediately alarming matter: the status of his physical self. Preoccupied as he was with matters of life and death, the first hint Eliot received that something wasn't quite right was, of all things, his nose. Eliot had always had a larger-than average nose. It wasn't ugly, exactly, but it was what could tactfully be called 'prominent.' Prominent enough, at least, that it usually entered the periphery of his vision. It wasn't something that bothered him—like the rhythmic ticking of a bedroom clock, it usually went unnoticed unless he was actively looking for it—but it was always there. And, like a clock's tick, the sudden absence was far more noticeable than the presence had ever been. Of course, his first response to this absence was to cast his eyes downward, which in turn revealed a whole host of body-image dissonance issues—the most immediate of which protruded a full 5 inches from his ribcage.

As he was still mentally a sexually frustrated nineteen year-old male, he groped, kneaded and massaged his new assets quite a bit more than was strictly necessary to confirm their authenticity, but before long panic overtook lechery and he started looking for clues as to what in the world had happened. Fortunately, this wasn't a difficult task seeing as the clue he sought was safety-pinned to the sleeve of his robe—a rectangle of hand-lettered cardstock, which read:

Dr. Charles Babbingtree's Costume Emporium
Unit No. 33487-S (Priestess of the Solstice—Initiate's Robes)
Size info. B34DD/W22/H36
Price: $149.99 ($179.99 w/ hood)


While Eliot had neither the expertise nor the tools to confirm the theory by checking to see if the measurements matched, he didn't have any trouble coming up with the obvious explanation for his current situation—that when he'd entered the doorway of light, he'd been reshaped into the image represented by the costume. He did, however, have trouble accepting that explanation.

"No," he said softly. "No, this isn't possible. I'm… I'm still unconscious. That's got to be it—this is all a dream."

But he knew in his heart that it wasn't. No dream was this real, this—tactile. Eliot could feel the cool country air rush down his throat with every breath, the tickle of every wisp of hair that played across his neck, the faint throbbing of his pulse reverberating deep within his ears. In that minute, he was more aware—more awake—than he'd ever been before. Whatever this was, it was no dream.

Faced with a world gone mad, the frightening idea that nothing he thought he knew about the nature of reality seemed to apply, Eliot did what he did best: he took stock. He was very good at this; Eliot had an excellent memory. Others called it "photographic" sometimes, but it wasn't like that, not really. He didn't replay his childhood like videos in his head; he didn't store memories like snapshots, to be called upon and studied at will. He had to learn things, to pay attention to details just like everyone else. If he didn't notice something when walking into a room, he was no more able than his peers to remember it later. However, having once taken note of a fact, he was very unlikely to forget it, and this was where he shined. To be honest, he couldn't really understand why others forgot things, not really. It just didn't make sense to him the way others claimed to spontaneously 'unlearn' things they'd been taught, or to forget where they themselves had put something. When, in the eighth grade, his class had been challenged to memorize as many digits of 'pi' as they could, he was baffled by the contest. Surely the teachers meant to CALCULATE as many digits of pi as they could, didn't they? But they did not, and so he recited the first thousand digits and been awarded a prize as though it were somehow a remarkable achievement rather than just reading a boring string of numbers and repeating it.

But now all his facts, all his memories, were suddenly worthless. Everything he'd learned about the world, about what was possible—even what he knew about his own body!—had become instantly obsolete. So he began again. Starting with himself, he took note of every detail. His hair, now a shining Venetian blonde, fell about his shoulders in bouncing curls. He already knew the horizontal shape of his figure form the card, but judging from the way the robes swept the ground when he walked, he was also at least a couple of inches shorter than he'd been as a man. His legs and arms were smooth and hairless; he wasn't quite sure what to make of that. He knew humans normally had the same number of follicles as their ape cousins—nearly 50 million—just much smaller, thinner hairs. Apparently even basic facts of human anatomy had been turned topsy-turvy going through that door. Speaking of 'human anatomy,' Eliot turned his attention to his other… new parts. Unfortunately, there wasn't much he could determine. Thanks to his lanky frame, large nose and geeky inclinations, he hadn't exactly gathered a large body of comparative experience in that area. Everything seemed 'normal' enough apart from the complete lack of hair, but he didn't really feel comfortable dwelling on the subject. All of his knowledge on the subject came from biology diagrams anyway, so he wasn't confident he'd be able to identify even if something were out of place.

Instead, he turned his attention at last to his surroundings. The hill upon which he stood was covered in long, wild grass and some small plants he couldn't identify, but a few hills over smoke curled from the chimneys of a small hamlet. The buildings clearly weren't modern, not unless thatch roofing was some new environmentalist statement, but at least it was civilization of a sort. In the distance, rolling forests backed up against snow capped mountains and thin dirt roadways snaked between the hills. The landscape looked—well, to be perfectly honest it looked like one of those paintings so often chosen as the cover of cheesy fantasy novels without the budget to commission a unique scene to match the book's setting. All that was missing was a party of—

And that's when Eliot noticed the three figures walking purposefully across the hills in his direction. A trio, varied in garb and carrying large packs and formidable weaponry, that looked like nothing so much as a party of adventurers.

That confirmed it. He'd had his suspicions, but the adventurers were just too much to ignore. He knew not how, nor why, nor for how long; but somehow—impossibly—he was in a land of fantasy. A world, as Babbingtree had put it, of magic, swordplay and high adventure. That these adventurers were passing by just this place at just this moment was likely no coincidence; he suspected that, should he choose to try, he'd find them all too willing to accept his companionship for one reason or another. But did he want that? Did he want to stick to the rails of this twisted game, or should he take control, head off in a direction of his own choosing?

What, Eliot wondered, should he do?
1232211.title: Enter the strange landscape.

choices: The group understands the language used.
12322111.content:
Struggling with the ideas of how he was to learn more about this world, Eliot made up his mind to try the adventurers. Picking up his body from the grass, he headed off on an intercept path to the group. On his way there, picking slowly around the occasional heaps of dung, the adventurers came more into focus. When Eliot was finally close enough, he made to call out to the group, making their way along the path. As he opened his mouth, the thought crossed his mind that these people might not speak a language he could understand.

To late for that now, he though, calling out in his, or her, new voice "Hail the party! Hello there!"

Despite knowing it would happen, Eliot still gave a little jump as the three heads turn towards him, with their attached bodies soon following...

“Yes, yes, my name is Steve. Well this is a little embarrassing, but I’m looking for something for my wife and I. Something to spice things up in the bedroom, if you know what I mean. She’s into role play, specifically reverse role play where she is the man and - " He lowered his voice. " - I'm the woman. I’m not really into such things, but she mentioned that wearing a costume may help me get into the proper mood. She suggested that I come to your shop in fact. She said you had just about everything and would be very discreet and understanding.”

The young man's explanation came to a stop and he took a deep breath.

Mr. Babbingtree merely smiled as he has heard this story before. “Yes, my good man, I think I can help you out. Your girlfriend was right to send you here. Let me take you back to our couple’s costumes. Now tell me what kind of thing you’re looking for. I have the standard stripper and customer, prison guard and prisoner, maid and boss, master and slave, Indian princess and cowboy, and such costumes. Or would you like to get a little more exotic?”

1241211.content:
Steve figured that it must be a one-size-fits all, although it didn't make much sense to him how that would work for such a tiny dress. It looked like it was meant for a 5'5", size 2 woman, and with the amount of in the chest region, he figured it must be for a big-breasted, 5'5", size 2 woman.

He shrugged the thought off and took of his clothes to put on the dress. Alexis had already showed him how to put on dresses already, but they were standard dresses and didn't "put him in the mood" as she said these costumes were supposed to.

He looked down at the dress before he fully slipped it on. It wasn't as small as the novelty sex dresses, it looked like an actual maid could wear it. He supposed it would go down to his upper legs, but if on the woman it seemed to be built for, it would reach her knees. She had long black hair, held in place with a silver clip, and she was dressed in a red suit with big black buttons, red boots, and black mittens. Dr Babbingtree could see soft white wool lining all of her clothes.

"May I help you, madam?" he asked her.

"Oh, thank you," she smiled, dragging her eyes from the many isles, boxes, and corridors of costumes. "My husband bought me this," she indicated the suit she was wearing, "to wear to a dress-up party. But, as you can see, it was missing a hat."

"I can see," Dr Babbingtree looked at her over his very fancy half-moon spectacles. "So would you be needing a hat, or would you like to try another costume? I have lots, you know."

She glanced down at herself, looking several times fatter than usual, and certainly much fluffier. "Well...what other costumes do you have?" she asked.

"Oh, many, many..." Dr Babbingtree leaned forwards confidentially. "They say," he whispered, "that my store is the biggest in the world."

"O-Oh, I see.." she smiled, and nodded.

"They say," he whispered, "that you can even get lost in here."

She smiled again, but he didn't seem to be paying attention.

"They say," he whispered again, "that the costumes in here are magical. You, madam, could turn into anything or anyone, even teleport to other worlds, if you go down the right corridors wearing the right costumes."

She took a step back. "I-I see. Well..."

"Excellent choice, one I didn't really expect. I wish you luck, and I hope you come again!", Babbingtree said as ......... left his store, heading to her new life.
142211122.title: She takes the new life (but there's a catch)

When he got into the bathroom he was surprised to see he no-longer has the clothe or where he had the bank bag stuck in his shirt before found nothing. He had on a bra and panties along with slacks and blouse. He then realizes that after taking off the blouse He then also takes the bra off and sees real breast but what's stranger is that his stomach has a slight bump as if pregnant. S/he then goes and redresses and goes out to the counter and asked what happened.

The guy says that these costumes are magic and they transform and the person start a new life.
