They think he really is a woman
142212.content:
The bank robber started to squirm when he saw the two policemen approach him. He could hear them say 'Look there he is' - 'No that can't be him, he is too short and thin' said the other one.

The two officers asked the robber to lift his veil.
142212.title: The police see through the disguise

1422121.content:
The bank robber, with little other option, lifted the veil. The policeman who had thought him too short and thin immediately apologized, but the other cut him off and moved closer, staring and squinting intently at the robber's face. Then, ignoring the protests from his colleague, he reached out and pulled the burqa back. A long strand of dark hair fell down over the robber's face and he squirmed some more at the confirmation of his own transformation.

"Ah ha! The scar above the right eyebrow!" the suspicious policeman cried. "It's him; it's Sammy Scarface! I bet we'll find a bullet hole in her somewhere too."

"You can't actually believe this place is magic!" his colleague wailed, as the other made to handcuff the robber.

The robber, his disguise blown, -
1422121.title: They know the shop is magic

choices: She faints from blood loss and shock
14221212.content:
"Suspect is resisting arrest!" the policeman yelled as he struggled on the floor of the shop with the transformed Sammy Scarface.

"Of course she's resisting arrest!" the other policeman roared. "You're trying to pull her traditional religious garment off! Officer Creely, if you don't stop RIGHT NOW I'm going to have to report you for religious insensitivity."

With a triumphant cry of 'aha!', Officer Creely jumped to his feet, pulling Sammy with him. The garment had been dragged down and bundled around her handcuffed wrists to reveal a worryingly-wan Arabian woman dressed in jeans and a blood-soaked shirt. Sammy Scarface took one look at herself and promptly paled even further.
14221212.title: Gets handcuffed

142212121.content:
The events of the last few minutes finally took their toll on Sammy and due to the mix of the aftershock of a full body transformation and the blood loss, Sammy fainted into Officer Creely's arms. "Sammy's had quite a day, I'll take him to the hospital and keep him under a close watch."

The younger officer disagreed with this plan, "Officer Creely you can't do that! You can't have this woman arrested and under surveillance because she has a similar scar to the suspect, she's not the right race or gender. You're doing some messed up profiling sir and I'm going to have to report you."

Officer Creely smiled as he looked at the younger officer. Officer McDonald had just joined the force about a year ago and while he was good and showed potential there were still a lot of things the kid needed to learn. "McDonald I assure you I'm in the right on this one, but if you don't trust me go on into the costume store and you'll figure things out. Call me up whenever you're done exploring." Creely gave a wink at that last part.

"Officer Creely I don't think..."

"It'll be okay, I know the owner and I doubt he'd mind you having a quick look around the place, I'll vouch for you if you get in too deep. Now go check out the store while I take Sammy to the hospital." And with that Officer Creely drove off leaving young Officer McDonald in front of the costume shop.

McDonald just shook his head and spoke to himself, "I doubt that whatever I find in this place will ever make me think that woman could be Sammy Scarface...but maybe their could be some clues. I guess I should check the place out." And so Officer McDonald cautiously made his way to the costume store.
142212121.title: She faints from blood loss and shock

choices: Sammy senses an opportunity to escape
142212122.content: The two officers continue to argue with each other - 'You see, he is wearing Sammy's clothing and has been shot as well!' - 'Impossible! Look at her, there is no way she could be Sammy. You are going to get the entire department sued.' The sympathetic officer then turned to Sammy and started to apologize profusely.
142212122.title: Something else

choices: Sammy gets some much-needed medical attention
1422121221.content:
Sammy hadn't gotten where he was today as an infamous bank robber without the ability to think fast and lie convincingly. He wasn't sure why he was a girl but he knew an opportunity when he saw one, and collapsed into the sympathetic policeman's arms with such an impressive display of sobbing that even Officer Creely was unsure about his identity.

The sympathetic policeman, unsure on how to comfort a woman who'd so recently been wearing a burka, gave her a non-contact 'there there' pat, said "let's take you away from the mean policeman" and, with a warning glare at his colleague, began to guide Sammy towards the exit.

"But - but - but..." Creely stammered.
1422121221.title: Sammy senses an opportunity to escape

choices: Sammy tries to get revenge now
14221212212.content:
As the sympathetic police officer calls for an ambulance, Sammy tries plotting revenge on the other officer. Sammy has long-hated this man ever since he sent Sammy to prison a few years ago.

As Sammy looks around the store and sees costumes such as strippers outfits and a HOOTERS uniform with room for extremely large breasts, he wonders if there is some way to force one of the slutty costumes on the officer, thereby turning him into an attractive young woman without a very bright future in front of her.
14221212212.title: Sammy does something else

choices: The wound is superficial - patched up and sent home
A longer stay at the hospital
142212122122.content:
Revenge could wait, Sammy reluctantly decided as he was bundled into a waiting ambulance. The trip to the hospital was a pain:

"Ma'am, do I have permission to remove your shirt."

"Yeah, sure."

"Ma'am, do I have permission to touch your body."

He glared at the paramedic. "I'm bleeding all over the place and you're the guy with the bandages. What do you think?"
142212122122.title: Sammy can wait until later

choices: Robber tries to get shop-keeper out of trouble
Robber looks for a back door
1422122.content:
The first police officer turned to the robber. "Lift your veil please, sir."

The bank robber was strangely offended at being called sir. But he had other things to worry about. He knew he was sunk if they saw his face. Sure his body was different, but who knew how his face looked? Maybe he was still recognisable.

On the plus side...wearing one of these things meant he couldn't take it off in public. That would be VERY inappropriate. He wasn't sure how he knew, but he did, and there was no way he was removing any clothing for these men, even if he didn't want to offend them. He had better pretend to be a woman.

"That would be an offence to my religion, sirs, and, I apologise, but I am a woman." he said, in a strongly accented voice that was definitely not his. And definitely not male.

"Oh...ma'm, we are terribly sorry. Please, do not trouble to remove the veil," the second policeman glared at the first. They both turned on the unfortunate shop-owner, the second policeman hissing "I told you it wasn't him".

"I assure you sirs," said the shop-owner with much flourishing of hands and a fancy bow, "I have never seen whoever you are looking for, unless it is that person there. She is the only human inside my shop." He straightened from his bow and pointed at the bank robber. "I apologise madam, for pointing so rudely, but one must make allowances for the police."

"It is quite all right, sir," replied the bank robber. He was actually thinking, "What the hell have you done you crazy man?!" but there was little to no chance he could ask at the moment.

The policemen shrugged, and grabbed the shop owner. "YOU, sir, are under arrest. I don't know how you changed outfits so fast, but you are the only man in this room. The bank robber definitely came in here. You must be him." They dragged the unfortunate shop-owner outside, standing outside the door to write him up.

"Damn," thought the bank robber, "No escape there."
1422122.title: They think he really is a woman

1423.content: What other options is there?
1423.title: Something else

143.content:
"Excuse me..Do you have a restroom I can use?" Delia hated to ask people for things as mundane as this but she really REALLY had to go.

She shifted the weight of her backpack slightly in hopes that her cat wasn't poking his paw up out of it again; Leo had gotten them thrown out of so many places now and she didn't want to risk pissing off this sweet-looking old man.

He pointed out the restroom sign and she ignored the look of pity on his face when he realized that she was obviously homeless. She had on dirty shorts,flip flops that were too large for her feet and a stained shirt; her other belongings were crammed into the duffel bag she held close to her side as she made her way through the rows of fancy schmancy costumes to the rear of the store where the restrooms were.

"Young lady..."

Delia groaned when she heard his voice coming through the closed door to the restroom and she swiftly tried to recall if she'd locked the door because Leo was out roaming around the tiny bathroom to stretch his legs for even the briefest of minutes.

"Young lady... I have a gift for you, being as it's almost Halloween and no young lady as pretty as yourself should be without a costume... I'll leave it outside the door for you."

This man could NOT be real, Delia thought to herself yet she could hear him leaving and a frown marred her forehead as she finished her business, tucked Leo back into her back pack and carefully opened the door to find an outfit, complete with wig and shoes, folded neatly outside the bathroom door along with a smaller costume obviously meant for Leo, meaning that he'd seen the cat.

She unfolded the costume to discover a detailed Medieval gown of rich burgundy velvet with the most delicate of creamy lace accents, a pointy hat to match it had a sheer gauze train falling from it and what looked to be burgundy velvet ballet slippers sat beneath a wig that was made of intricately laced ebony braids... the cat's costume was one that made her laugh... it was a small unicorn costume that he'd hate to have put on him.

Of course she couldn't keep the costumes... could she?
143.title: Delia and Leo

144.content:
What had at first appeared to be a look of awe quickly became one of shock and mild-disgust as the figure approached the desk. He was tall and wiry beneath a velvet gown, and sported an expertly-styled, twisted goatee.

Babbingtree leaped off his stool in recognition.

"My word! Prendergast, my old friend, I haven't seen you since our University days. How are you? What have you been up to?"

Prendergast's face, which had been busy sneering at a display of fake noses, broke into a smile that didn't look like it got used much. The two old wizards shook hands. "I'm well, B-tree, I'm very well. And I work for the Government now," he said, somewhat pointedly.

"Ah," Babbingtree said, his face falling. "So this isn't a social visit..."

"Afraid not," the other wizard said, summoning up a chair from thin air on which to sit. "You see..."
144.title: An Old Acquaintance

choices: Babbingtree accepts - the government uses his costumes for evil
Babbingtree accepts - the government uses his costumes for good
Babbingtree refuses- the government steal the costumes anyway
1442.content:
"The United States Government has taken a very keen interest in your shop. Or rather, it's merchandise. Indefinite and stable transformations, easily transported and applied but, once worn, undetectable to modern technology and indistinguishable from the real thing. Their greatest wizards have been working on such things for decades, and then you come along with a warehouse stocked to the brim with them!"

Babbingtree blushed a little with professional pride. "You've tried the merchandise then?"

"Of course. We sent one of our best men in a few weeks ago to collect a sample." Prendergast scowled. "Even our Curse Breakers couldn't remove the effects. She's now living as an elf in a forest in Virginia."

"Good for him."

"Anyway... the point is, the US treasury has authorized me to be as generous as I see fit until your stock and services have been secured." From out of his long cloak, Prendergast drew a chequebook and quill, and scribbled down a number. It had a lot of zeros in it.

Babbingtree folded his arms. "I didn't get into magic to manufacture weapons. I know what you'll use my magic for - spying. And worse."

The other wizard shrugged and added another zero. "Perhaps. But think of all the good you could do. The witness protection program could really use you. And not to mention the advances to science and medicine... " He added a few more zeros, and kept on adding them untll...
1442.title: "I'm here to request your assistance."

choices: They weaponise Babbingtree's magic into gun form
14421.content:
Declining had never really been an option - they would have taken the merchandise either way. One of the draw-backs of upscaling the shop, he guessed. He should have stuck to his tiny backstreet shop; those had been good days - selling a few costumes to unwary customers before teleporting the whole enterprise to the next town on, leaving nothing behind but mystery and a few very unhappy customers.

But teleporting the larger shop had been totally unfeasible. Only a parade of military trucks could shift all that.

That's what you get for trying to bring magic to the masses, he sighed, taking one last look at the place. Its miles of shelves were stripped bare; only dust remained. The secret, underground, military magic-testing area they were sending him and his merchandise to wouldn't even compare.
14421.title: The government uses his costumes for evil

144211.content:
After months of surveillance. Prendergast had barely only begun to unravel Babbingtree's method. The man was a master craftsmage, producing enchanted attire at a rate and quality unmatched by his peers. It was worrying that a man of his talents had so nearly been wasted in the retail industry.

Anyway, the government had been demanding returns on their billion dollar investment, and so Prendergast had gathered together what little he'd gleaned of B-tree's craft, emulated it, and weaponised it into gun. It wasn't a particularly stable weapon and it's effects tended to spontaneously reverse after twenty minutes, but it would keep the investors off his back for another month.

From a high, mirrored window, he looked out over the testing area - a large room strewn with mock-up buildings, cars, plants, and pedestrians. The whole thing didn't look much more advanced than a LaserQuest arena, though he was sure it had taken several billion to build.

Two groups of soldiers were, in a round-about manner involving lots of rolling and shouting, were convening on the center, all of them carrying test versions of the new weapon. They all had two functions - one capable of firing a spell, turning the target into something hopefully less dangerous than it's current form, the other capable of transforming the wielder of the weapon into a person or object matching the current surroundings - in effect, a disguise function.

Assuming it worked; there was a high possibility the weapons would simply explode in the soldiers' hands.

Two of the combatants finally found each other in the testing area and brought their weapons to bear. There was a flash of light, and -
144211.title: They weaponise Babbingtree's magic into gun...

choices: a kid looking for zelda masks

1452.title: Nah

14521.content:
A group of four friends enter the store, Kenny, studying to be a programmer, the stereotypical geek, but generally well-liked by most people; Jeff, Kenny's fraternal twin brother, studying to be a Physician, he is athletic enough to play sports, but various medical problems keep him from his dream of playing; Philip, Jeffery's best friend, also studying to be a programmer, he's known Jeff and Kenny since they were 5, and is currently the starting tight end on the football team, but likes to play roleplaying games with Kenny and Jeff; Karen, Philip's girlfriend, studying to be a math teacher she was in Kenny's and Philip's Calculus class.

Dr. Babbingtree looks up and greets them, "Welcome to my store. I assume you are looking for some costumes?"

"Yeah, we're looking for costumes for our game." (Kenny had convinced Jeff to convince Philip to convince Karen to get costumes for their games)

Their game is
14521.title: Yes

choices: Noone's character is really like them
145211.content:
Kenny quickly goes into a in-depth description of the game while Dr. Babbingtree listens patiently, and soon has a twinkle in his eye.

"I believe I know exactly what you're looking for." Dr. Babbingtree exclaims at the end of the Kenny's description. "Follow me."

The small group followed Dr. Babbingtree through what seems like an endless row of costumes. "I didn't know there were even this many costumes in existance" Jeff whisped to Philip. "I know, the store looked alot smaller on the outside."

After what seemed like hours they ended up in a costume section that seemed to have been ripped straight from their game's world. "Wow." Kenny exclaimed, and quickly went around picking out which costumes everyone needed. While Jeff, Philip and Karen simply browsed curiously.

Soon Kenny came back with costumes for everyone's character.

Were the character's by personality (Kenny, the geek, is a mage. Jeff, athletic but sickly, and is studying to be a physican, is a Cleric. Philip, Football player, is Warrior. Karen, the future math teacher, particularly angles and trajectories, is a Archer/Ranger.), or their characters were just made randomly (Kenny has a warrior character, Philip a female cleric, etc.)
145211.title: To the Fantasy Section!

1452112.content: Does Kenny know the power of the costumes, while noone else does (except Dr. Babbingtree of course)?
1452112.title: Noone's character is really like them

choices: Kenny=Warrior, Jeff=Warrior (wolven race), Philip= Female Cleric, Karen=Assassin
14521121.content:
Kenny came back with a mischievious smile on his face as he held up the costumes for everyone.

What were everyone's costumes/characters?
14521121.title: Yes

145211211.content:
Kenny came back holding a chainmail warrior set, a very large set of armor that with a wolf on the front that seemed like no human alive would fit in, a white robe, and a black skintight suit.

"They were all next to each other, and they fit our characters perfectly!" Kenny exclaimed, he was obviously excited, but the others looked doubtful. Kenny quickly and quietly asked Dr. Babbingtree a question in his ear. "Yes, they reverse after removal, and if they don't just come back to my store and I'll be happy to fix it for you. And if you somehow die you'll just return to our world, costume in hand." Philip, Jeff, and Karen exchanged worried glances.

"What are you planning with those costumes, Kenny?" Jeff cautiously asked

"Oh don't worry it's harmless, and don't worry about payment, I'll cover it." Kenny replied as he and Dr. Babbingtree headed toward the front of the store.

"Will those even fit?" Philip asked.

"Oh, you'll find that you adjust to them very easily" Dr. Babbingtree replied, "Please try to stay with us, you don't want to get lost."

They made it back to the check-out counter after another seemingly endless walk. Kenny paid Dr. Babbingtree and took the costumes and put them in his trunk. "Don't forget, Friday, my house."

Does anything happen during the week before Friday?
145211211.title: Kenny=Warrior, Jeff=Warrior (wolven race), Phil...

choices: Jeff went to the bathroom to put on the armor.
1452112111.content:
Philip was going over to Kenny's after practice that night, his classes and practice had made him completely forget about the costumes. But when he arrived his was bluntly reminded by Kenny shoving it in his face. "Hurry up, we've all been waiting for you to get here."

Philip had never seen Kenny so excited for something in the 15 years that he'd known him. "Ok, sorry football practice went a little late."

He came into the living room to find Jeff and Karen already there. Jeff looked dwarfed by the armor sitting beside him, and although Karen had a nice body, whoever the black suit was designed for was definately not Karen.

"Well now that we're all here, let's try them on!" Kenny was practically stripping down.

"KENNY!" Karen yelled out of shock. "What are you thinking!?"

"Oh sorry, I'm so excited! I'll put mine on first." Kenny ran off toward the bathroom.

"Is this a women's costume?" Philip said as he saw the robe for the first time up close. "How am I supposed to wear these?"

"OK, NEXT PERSON!" the sound of Kenny's voice came from the bathroom.

Philip walked over toward the bathroom. "Hey Kenny, you know you got me women's clothes, right?"

"Isn't your character a female?" was Kenny's reply, though his voice sounded a bit deeper.

"Whatever" Philip thought to himself as he walked into the bathroom. "How am I supposed to get these on?" He checked the robe for instructions but all he found were the sizes (32D-24-34) which obviously weren't for 6'5", 239 pounds football players. He decided just to throw it over his head and hope it worked. The clothes seemed to stretch and fit fairly well around his thick frame.

He walked to the hall and started to head back to the others when Kenny grabbed him and pulled him back to the kitchen. "Just say 'Next person', ok?".

"Next person!" Philip called, but his voice felt wrong, it was obviously his, but it felt just a tone higher. Then again, how did Kenny easily pull him into the kitchen? Nothing against Kenny but he was only 5'8", 160 pounds, and barely an ounce of muscle. Philip turned around to find himself face-to-face with a 6'4" man who was more muscular than some of the stronger football players. "Holy S---" Kenny's hand went over Philip's mouth before he could finish the obscenity or scream, or make anyother noise for that matter.

What happened next?
1452112111.title: Friday Night

14521121111.content:
As the sounds of Jeff's footstep headed toward the bathroom. Philip began to feel very weird, his robe started to shrink down to its original size, and he was shrinking with it. Some of his features started growing softer. His muscular arms and powerful legs began to slim and lose their masculine strength, and his hands beat up from practice and calloused from weightlifting started to become slim and his fingers became narrower. He could feel himself getting smaller, as the now incredibly muscular Kenny who stood even with him just five seconds ago was now a good 6 inches taller. He could feel his size 16 feet become petite in the sandals that came with the robe. His facial feature became lighter, and smaller. Something hit him like a punch in the groin and soon his manhood was replaced by something feminine, he looked down to see, but blocking the view of his crotch was a certain pair of female parts that suddenly felt very heavy. "What th---" he stopped his own sentence short because of the sound of his own voice. He scurried over to the kitchen mirror above the sink to find that he was a stunningly beautiful woman with long brunette hair (at least his hair color hadn't changed), and a knockout figure.

He was about to yell, or scream when once again Kenny put his hands over his mouth, "Shh... It needs to be a surprise for Jeff and Karen."

All Philip could do was look at the mirror. He finally noticed Kenny's ears, they were slightly pointed, and then remembered Kenny had picked a quarter-elf as his race (it was unanimously decided that a half-elf and human could make a quarter-elf baby when Kenny first brought up the notion of wanting to be a human with some elven powers, but not to the extent of a half-elf.)

Did Philip choose a character of a different race?
14521121111.title: Philip began to change

145211211111.content:
Philip was momentarily distracted from his predicament by Kenny's ears. He wondered what it felt like to be a different race, or at least partially, but then remembered his current state and thought about Jeff in the bathroom. What had he been? Philip was too distracted by his new body to think clearly. Wasn't he, part animal? Oh yeah! He had made a character from the Wolf Clan of the North. "Oh no." Philip breathed into Kenny's thick hand covering his mouth.

Kenny dragged him (or her, now) over to the bathroom, he was ready to catch Jeff as he walked out. Jeff came out and was instantly grabbed by Kenny.

"Jeez Phil, you scared me!" He said as he was about to turn around. Kenny whispered in his ear to tell him to say that it was Karen's turn. He complied and soon Karen's footsteps could be heard down the hallway. The bathroom door could be heard closing, and Karen verbally wondering "Where did they go, and why even bother putting this on?"

What happened Next?
145211211111.title: No, he picked a human

1452112111112.content:
Karen had changed into her costume surprisingly fast and came out of the bathroom and turned into the kitchen to find a muscular man who slightly resembled Kenny, holding a woman who slightly resembled her boyfriend, and Jeff growing hair out of his face at an alarming rate. She watched dumbfounded as Jeff began to grow to about 7'4", his nose began to flatten and extend away from his face as his chin followed. A coat of silver-grey fur began to cover his body, his arms were about as thick as telephone poles and were growing the same silver hair. His mouth was open in shock, and she could see his teeth becoming pointed. His feet had been bare so she could see his toenails become pitch-black claws on furry, 4-toed, humanoid feet. His fingernails underwent the same changes, and a tail seemed to be coming out of a gap in his platearmor.

Karen missed the last of the transformations as she was undergoing her own. He body was becoming slimmer, and better toned. She lost every ounce of fat she had on her as it was replaced with lean muscle. Her blonde hair became black, and a scar appeared over her right eye (She had taken a glancing blow by an axe-wielding orc to her face, or at least she had in the game.). She could feel her senses heighten, and she could now notice about everything around her. Her skin grew to a very light shade of purple, almost as if someone airbrushed a light coat of lavender on her skin. Her ears also grew elongated a pointed. Her other changes were minor and didn't distract her from watching Jeff's final change as his eyes turned from there normal green to a silver-blue.

"Yes! Who is ready to go into the game world?" Kenny asked.

"What the heck did you do to us, Kenny?" Came a growl from the behemoth that was Jeff.

"I learned of Dr. Babbingtree's store about 2 weeks ago when, you and Karen went to Philip's football game." (Kenny had had a bad case of the flu that week and stayed home) "I browsed the internet for local stores that had stuff that could enhance role playing games and found his store, with costumes that could turn you into anyone. I also got this!" He produced a small box from under the table and set it on the table. He opened it and pulled out a small device that looked like a sundial. "This will make a world for us to do anything in, and after talking to Mr. Babbingtree it's set to an exact replica of our game, Towns, Dungeons, even to the slightest hill. It's completely perfect, and we're going to go questing it!"

"What about here though? Won't people notice if we're gone, or look completely different?" Philip said motioning to his new curves.

"No time pauses out here in this world. We can stay in the world until we need a break from it, or until you die in it. That's what I asked Dr. Babbingtree, what would happen if we died in the other world. You heard his reply, we show up here with the costume in hand, and probably frozen until the rest of us come out." Kenny explained.

"I'm still skeptical" said Wolf-man Jeff.

"Too bad... here we go!" Kenny exclaimed as he hit the button in the center of the dial before anyone else could make an objection.

What part of their world do they wind up in?
1452112111112.title: Changes, for better or for worse?

choices: Continue from where they left off.

choices: Go to meet the royal family
Try to find his friends first
145211211111211.content:
Starting at the beginning, the group was placed into their positions as their background stories unfolded. They weren't overly complicated stories, just enough to make their group band together and fight the evil that had begun spreading (not exactly an original story, but that's how most RPGs are.).

Kenny's beginning was pretty standard for the "hero" of the story, he was the son of another hero and was expected to do great deeds as he matured, but during a ceremony in which he was to meet the royal family after slaying the most recent dragon to decend on the town of Oakfrost. As he is going to meet the family a group of bandits claiming to be the "hand of Tyanus", gravely wound the king and kidnap the princess to offer as sacrifice to Tyanus to increase Tyanus's power, and hopefully give them power too. Needless to say his story begins trying to reclaim the Princess, who's been locked in a dark tower outside town until midnight of the new moon (about 5 days away).

Kenny appears right at the part where he is getting ready to meet the family. He knows what part of the story he is at, but does he:
145211211111211.title: Beginning

choices: Continue with Kenny, Jeff, and Karen.
1452112111112111.content:
Kenny decides the best way to find his friends is follow the current plot. He enters the castle with little difficulty, passes through to the keep and enters the Great Hall. Obviously he knows what will happen next, but he is expecting it so much, it surprises him when it happens. Three bandits break the windows on both sides of the hall. One throws a handful of explosives, much like flashbangs, at the guards, stunning and dazing them. Kenny is caught in one of the blasts and is blinded momentarily as the sound of a woman yelling (she isn't screaming, she is cursing at the bandits with everything she's got.) starts and then slowly fades. Kenny's vision clears to find that the King has been stabbed in the chest and may very well die (they never decided his fate), with shallow breath the king asks Kenny to go and find his daughter.

Kenny sets off immediately, hoping that Jeff heard the sound of the blasts (this was the part where he was supposed to come in. Jeff's background story was that he was the first and only Royal Guard that was from the Wolf Clan). and as if on cue Kenny finds his face hitting a suit of armor with a wolf on it and Jeff's wolfish new face looking down at him.

"It's happened, hasn't it?" Jeff asks Kenny in his wolfish voice, already knowing the answer.

"Yes, and hopefully that means Karen is right around the corner." Kenny replies as they leave the castle and start to make their way to the town gate. And sure enough Karen is soon running along side them.

"So then he's with...?" Karen begins her question.

"Yep, Phil's been kidnapped." Kenny replies.
1452112111112111.title: Go to meet the royal family

14521121111121111.content:
It was a simple enough game at the beginning, make a character any way you want, roll the dice for stats, and create a background, for one week and the rest of the time would be spent playing, until they beat the quest, or their characters died trying.

Of course Philip was now regretting making his character the way he did.

Philip had appeared in the world in bed, the best bed that Philip had ever seen in his life. It was at least five times bigger than the small bed he had in his apartment, had at least two dozen pillows, and had several layers of fancy sheets and blankets.

His character, Phyllis (He was never the most creative namer), was known throughout the land as the "Tomboy Princess". She would rather be out making adventure instead of meeting officials, signing documents, and being treated as if a simple pebble could break her neck, and she had secretly been studying with the King's mage and cleric, learning the ways of the mage's magic and the prayer's of the cleric (though she was clearly better at calling on the gods help rather than twisting the elements), she would liked to have learned to swordfight, but none of the King's fighters would waste their time for someone who would never use the craft.

Philip got out of the bed to find himself (now herself), not in the cleric robes she had changed in, but in a gold lined nightgown with precious jewels embroidered into the seams. Philip felt humiliated for wearing the gown and even more humiliated by being in the body of a woman, and the new foreign feelings that came with it. She sighed, and began to sit on the bed, but as soon as she was sitting, a group of girls (presumably her new maids) came in and told her that she was going to be late, for the meeting with "her hero" (Knowing who "her hero" was, Philip would rather strangle "her hero" instead of graciously dining beside him during the Hero's Feast.). Soon Philip ---||Note: I'm going to refer to "he" as "she", when he is Phyllis(It's just getting too confusing)||--- found herself out of her nightgown and being prepped for a dress, that was so big Philip thought she would suffocate in. The maids quickly put Philip in a extremely tight corset (forget the dress, she was going to suffocate now!). The maids worked so fast that Philip barely could keep up with their movements, and soon he was in a beautiful dress (though Philip thought it must have been spawned in Hell for how tight it was.)

He was then sent downstairs, waiting for Kenny to arrive. (He hadn't played the day that Phyllis was kidnapped due to a elongated football practice, and the whole kidnapping story was Kenny's idea, and he had completely forgot about the kidnapping.) After what seemed like an enternity to her, her hero Kenny, finally showed up. Just as Philip was about to make the comment "What the hell took you so long?" The windows shattered around her, and she soon found a violent arm wrapped around her and dragging her off. Philip began to use every swear word she knew. The bandit, slightly surprised that a princess would use such language, produced a small pill and shoved it down Philip's throat, although he got a nice imprint of her teeth on his hand, and soon the princess was out cold.
14521121111121111.title: Philip's Predicament

choices: Philip's life as a damsel in distress
The time of the sacrifice has arrived
145211211111211112.content:
Philip groggily opened her eyes. "Good god, what happened? Where am I?" She started to get up, but then realized the she was still a girl. "Crap, it's not a dream." She looked down to find she was still wearing the dress, but it was now dirty and torn. She wandered over to the window and found herself at the top room of a gigantic tower. There was no castle, just a giant tower jutting out of the ground. Philip figured it must be at least 70 feet tall.

There was a loud knock at the door. "Wakey, wakey princess, time for your food. Can't have ya dieing of starvation before we sacrifice ya." The guard chuckled and tossed what looked to be a rat (a very charred, burnt rat) inside, the smell of the still smouldering hair almost make Philip vomit. She decided she would wait a bit before even considering eating it. The food slit slammed shut an the guard's footsteps could be heard moving away from the door down the hall.

"Kenny, I'm going to slit your throat when I see you next." Philip thought to herself. She'd finally remembered the first quest that Kenny made: Save her from a grisly sacrificial death. Hopefully they would save her before the last minute (as it had unfolded in their tabletop game).

She sighed and noticed her chest rise and fall. It was the first time she really "noticed" the new changes. Sure she felt them when they first occurred, but then Kenny had sent them into this damned world, and then she'd been kidnapped about 30 minutes afterwards, not ever having a break to get accustomed to this body. It was a new feeling, the weight of her breasts (she might have been OK if they were smaller, but these weren't small by any stretch.), not to mention the openness she now felt between her legs. It was an unnerving sensation, and she didn't want to think any more on the matter. So, she went back to the small rotting cot that was now her bed and laid down. "Hurry up, Kenny or I'll make killing you five times worse." She thought before drifting off to sleep.
145211211111211112.title: Locked up

1452112111112111121.content:
As she remembered it, she had five days before the moon was right to sacrifice her. Or at least that's what she thought it was.

After she woke up again, she met the leader of the bandits, he was actually somewhat polite to her. He was only about 3 inches taller than her and kind of scrawny, with short blonde hair and crystal blue eyes. He was not exactly the stereotypical bandit leader, but Philip soon found out why he was leader. He had let her come downstairs for an hour for a meal (which was far better than a charcoal rat), when one of the other bandits, obviously drunk tried to take her to his room, but as soon as he started to drag her toward the stairs, the leader had put a knife in his throat before Philip had even seen him move. The other bandit was dead before he even hit the ground. He politely apologized and escorted her back to his room where she could rest and recuperate from the ordeal. As soon as she was inside the room he left, locking the door behind him.

It wasn't the bed she had woken up in when she first entered this world, but it was definitely better than the rotting cot, and even better than the beds at "his" college dorm. She momentarily thought back to the real world, where "she" was a "he", and "he" was a big, muscular tight end, but that was in that world. But on the other hand she had gotten more used to this body, although she still wasn't ready to actually look at herself in the mirror again quite yet, let alone actually touch the two fleshy mounds on her chest. It was as if ignoring them would make her turn back to the way "he" was before. She then realized she hadn't used the restroom since she had been here. She'd been dreading this moment, she had no idea how to take off the dress, work the elaborate undergarments, or even HOW to use the restroom, but the thought of it brought on the urge.

She found that a fairly lavish bathroom was attached to the bedroom she was in and moved over to it. She fumbled with the dress trying to get it off, or at least in a decent position. The dress was still tight, despite the fact it was ripped in multiple places. She finally managed to find a catch in the back, which was obviously meant for someone other than the wearer to access. The top of the dress relaxed and allowed her to get it off. The undergarments, which had taken her chambermaids about 5 minutes to put on, turned out to be mainly support for her chest, which she was trying to avoid looking at. The panties were the same as "his" boxers (or at least in the means of removal, his boxers didn't hug his hips, end right under the crotch, nor were they pink, frilly or made of silk) She slid them down, still trying to avoid looking at her feminine parts. She found it annoying, after having all lived all her life with control of the stream, to have to adjust herself to keep it in the bowl. After what seemed like an eternity, he finally slipped the panties back up. She was relieved she had managed to avoid looking at her privates.

After struggling about 30 minutes to slip the dress back on, she went back to the bedroom, and instantly crawled on the bed, and once again planned revenge against Kenny before drifting to sleep, although this time it was less about killing him, and more about torturing him by making him the girl when they returned to the real world.

14521121111121111211.content:
Philip woke up to the bandit leader standing over her. She jumped back, but the leader either didn't notice, or was pretending not to have.

"You may have picked this up from some of the talk, but we are sacrificing you in three days time to resurrect Tyanus." The leader said in a solemn voice.

"Yeah, I kinda got that." Philip replied.

"No doubt there will be a rescue attempt before then, and as much as I would rather not kill a pretty thing like you, I have to follow my brothers' orders and prevent your liberation or face my own execution." The leader explained, when suddenly his demeanor changed to somewhat of the polite man he was yesterday. "It's so rude that I know your name and yet you do not know mine. Princess Phyllis of Oakfrost, I am Erik Barott, 3rd in command of the Red Dagger Clan."

"Erik..." Philip said the name aloud. It had an extremely familiar ring to it. Why wouldn't it, he was a character in their game, but she was fairly sure the Erik she was thinking of wasn't a bandit, but for the life of her couldn't remember what Erik's role was.

Suddenly there was a knock on the door to Erik's room. "Commander Erik...

145211211111211112111.content:
...Your brother Klien has arrived" said the messenger

"Fine, send him in." Erik tensed up and stood at rigid attention toward the door which was beginning to open.

A monster of a man entered the room. He was a good foot and a half taller than Erik, and by the looks of it he could snap Erik in half. He had many cuts and scars all over his body. He was the complete opposite of what you would expect Erik's brother to look like. His jet black hair seemed to suck all color out of Erik's blond hair. He had a chiseled face that had a sinister look to it.. The only thing common between Erik and Klien was their blue eyes.

After taking in Klien, Philip looked at his belt and saw a huge sword clasp to it. It had to be at least three feet long, and had grisly notches evenly spaced down the blade, much like saw teeth.

"Is that the Princess?" His deep voice was like a boom of thunder even though he had not raised his voice.

"Yes, Klien, that's her. Some of the men tryed to have their way with her, but they were disposed of in a suitable manner." Philip figured it must have been that man who tried to drag her to his room.

"Good, she looks perfect for the sacrifice." He pulled out his sword and held it to Philip's throat. "I could just cleave your pretty little head off right now if I wanted to. Your pitiful little friends I saw on their way here won't have a chance. And I thought the Kingdom actually wanted you back, the only thing they're getting back are the bodies of those three 'heroes' in tiny little pieces." He left the room laughing.

Philip was completely terrified of this Klien character, though she didn't remember him. Erik saw her trembling and tryed to confort her. "Don't worry, my other brother won't be coming until the sacrifice, but you won't meet him, which is good. He's much worse." He shifted a bit as if trying to think of something nice to do. "You can stay in my room until the date of the sacrifice, and I brought you some better clothes while you were sleeping, so you don't have to worry getting in and out of that damned dress."

info.brief_description: A mysterious costume store that offers a whole new life.
info.description:
The costume store is very large building, which sells a limited variety of costumes. They are tailored for everyone, ranging from the common, to the rare, to items tailored for bizarre and unusual tastes.

The costumes the shop sells are almost invariably enchanted so that donning a costume will often result in the wearer becoming the thing the outfit represents.

These effects can sometimes be reversed by removing the outfit. Other times only the owner of the store, Dr Charles Babbingtree (Ph.D in Magic).

Within the labyrinth of the store are many powerful artifacts for those brave or lost enough to find them, including a portal that will transport anybody who passes through it to a world fitting the costume they're wearing.
